reviewText: Excellent portrayal of actual events.  In the Bible we read that on the road to Emmaus Jesus explained to the disciples how the scriptures of the Old Testament point to Him.  In the movie we see what this might have looked like, how it might have felt,  and what Jesus might have said.  Excellent casting.  The film moves at a believable pace and serves as a great tool to help strengthen one's faith.

reviewerName: Beth of the World of Fiction and Beyond
reviewText: Road to Emmaus was wonderful.  It's the same Jesus as in the Visual Bible, Matthew.  It's 30 minutes based upon the Luke 24 account of Cleopas and his friend walking to Emmaus on the first Easter with Jesus, but they don't know it's Jesus.  The story is well told, and I was happy with the biblical accuracy.  Great job!!

This film offers different languages and did have the Chinese that they could understand,and he told me how much it was enjoyed by all and did induce discussion that was good for everyone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I greatly enjoyed,and benefited from, watching this 30 minute video, which I purchased. The video is very worthwhile to watch if you are a Christian, or want to know about what Christianity is. This is the classic story from Bible scripture. Jesus, 'after' his death on the cross, is found to be walking with two of his Disciples, who are quite upset and in a great quandry as to the meaning of Jesus' death, and what to do, now that they have lost their great leader. Tho the Disciples dont immediately recognize Jesus, it is He that walks with them on the road to Emmaus. Jesus allays their fears by explaining to them why the Messiah came, and why he died. I felt that the scenery and settings were very good, the acting was very clear and concise, and the words spoken were very helpful to me to understand why Jesus came to the earth, to create a loving relationship between Man and God, and between all Mankind to one another.
summary: Very good telling of the story

reviewText: Great production. Well worth the money.  Bruce Marchiano stars in it.  If you have seen Matthew on DVD you will recognize him as Jesus.  Hair is a little longer in the Road to Emmaus but still a wonderful portrayal of Jesus.  Well worth the money to watch again and again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the type of movie you show to your friends who want to know more about Jesus.  This is the type of movie you watch when you want to remind yourself how glorious Jesus is.  Bruce Marchiano plays a sincere and "human" Jesus.  It takes a bit of getting used to since most adaptations of Jesus' life does not have Him smiling much.  A shame since it is Jesus' humanity that makes Him easier for us to relate to and joy and sorrow go hand in hand. In summary, well worth the watch and will be watching it again and again..
summary: Good things come in small packages
